highlightedReviews.author: Lillys Osorio
highlightedReviews.text: üòÄToday I visited Cafe Latte. I was served by Duffez,üëàüëå who was very quick and friendly. Then a Mexican gentleman who speaks Spanishüí™ found me a menu and was very helpful. I will return and I recommend it. They have vegan and gluten-free options.‚ú®Ô∏è

highlightedReviews.author: Christian Engelbrecht
highlightedReviews.text: Visiting yesterday, I saw they were celebrating 40 years and I think I've been coming here about that long. I left Minnesota a while ago, but whenever I come back, this is often the first place I go. In an era of chains and copycat restaurants, I find this place truly unique and really appreciate that. The quality of food, I think, is also exceptional. I always look forward to my bowl of chili and a takeaway slice of turtle cake for later on. Thanks to the owners who started this and kept this going for the last 40 and all the best for the next 40 to come.

highlightedReviews.author: Rivix K
highlightedReviews.text: Easily one of my favorite places. Friendly service, clean building, and amazing desserts. So far I havent found a better place to get cake. I would definitely recommend during summer to get their fruit tart cake slice. Otherwise their chocolate cakes and cheesecake style cakes are a favorite of mine.

highlightedReviews.author: Magarara
highlightedReviews.text: I love their food! The desserts are another notch as Emeril used to say. The soup is beyond wonderful. I think it was artichoke leek I had. Given that it was -24¬∞ F, (-47¬∞ F with wind chill) it hit the spot. Unfortunately the prices have increased dramatically.

highlightedReviews.author: Jeannie Hill
highlightedReviews.text:
I've been going to¬†Cafe Latte¬†for years and years; meeting clients for business, taking a dear senior friend on an outing, going out to eat with fellow dancers before or after a class, or just for my own pleasure. It's a bit like a salad, soup, and sandwich bar, where you make selections and place your order as you go. However, I'd call this gourmet¬†quality menu entrees.

My favorite¬†is to order their three salad combos. The selection is great, with a good variety of flavors and cuisines, and they are unusually tasty.¬†Cafe Latte¬†serves both timeless, favorite comfort food, but also exceptional lattes, coffee, tea, and desserts. Individuals can select from gourmet pizzas to their¬†own award-winning Blueberry Lemon Scones and Turtle Cake.

If you want the European clotted cream / scone experience, this is as close as you can come to it in the United States. I highly recommend going for scones first thing in the morning, when you cannot the "fresh out of the oven" flavor.

Recently, I wanted to thank a helpful neighbor by gifting them with a cheesecake. I checked¬†closer to home, in Minnetonka, Eden Prairie, and Edina - no one else had full cheesecakes ready for pickup-and-go. Not only that, Cafe Latte, has them in three sizes as well as selling cheesecake by the slice. In addition, you have multiple¬†flavors to choose from. For my neighbor, I selected their Classic Vanilla Cheesecake. It's boxed nicely and is a stunning presentation with whipped cream and strawberries on top.

There are three distinct dining areas an upstairs, lower-level tables and booths, as well as the dessert/coffee lounge on the south end. Conveniently, they have two cash register areas.
Large men and women restrooms are available directly across the hall. There is street parking and a paid parking lot across the street on the west. To avoid peak hours, I recommend going mid-afternoon.

Excellent service. Top notch ambience.

highlightedReviews.author: Mathew Heart
highlightedReviews.text:
We ordered a ton of tres leches pastries in various flavors for our Christmas party, along with their chocolate truffles, and everything was perfect!

The packing was amazing--neat and secure. The service was excellent, and the staff made the entire process so smooth. As for the sweets, they were absolutely delightful! Every bite was flavorful and worth raving about.

The quality was top-notch, and everything was incredibly tasty. Parking on the street can be a bit of a challenge, but it's well worth the effort for treats this good.

Highly recommend for any special occasion--or just because!

highlightedReviews.author: Ia Vang
highlightedReviews.text: The last time I came here, I got overwhelmed and intimidated and just left LOL but that was back in high school. I'm an adult now and this place was still intimidating, but as soon as I got the gist of it, everything was easy and great. The cakes are delish, their pizzas are good, and their salad/sandwich bar is fast-paced. Only thing I'll complain about is that they don't have wifi... being that it's a cafe, I'm not sure why they don't. So if you plan to do school work or anything on your laptop, this may not be the best pick for you!! Overall, still a great establishment <3

highlightedReviews.author: Sandy Waterman
highlightedReviews.text: A favorite since the 1980s, at St. Paul's Victoria and Grand intersection..  Freshly prepared, flavorful salads, soups, coffee shop-style beverages, breads, and desserts, plus amaretto, coffee, and raspberry truffles (all three gluten free!).  Cafeteria line, plus table and booth seating on two levels.

highlightedReviews.author: asha p
highlightedReviews.text: One of my favourite spots for dessert date night. Have only tried the sweet treats so far, which tend to be on the pricier side. Have dined in a few times but depending on the time/day it can be very busy and hectic. The raspberry cream torte, banana cake, flourless chocolate cake, and vanilla tres leches were all very tasty.

highlightedReviews.author: Poppy
highlightedReviews.text: The food is excellent. My experiences with service have been mixed. Today, the chick serving was quite rude, rolling her eyes and sighing at me. I really can‚Äôt imagine why. I smiled, asked for what I wanted, and said thanks, that was the extent of the interaction, add in her asking one question, which I answered ‚Äúyes, please,‚Äù and and her unexplainable huffing and eye rolling. She did not greet me or thank me, only acted like I was somehow a pain in her side. I‚Äôm not asking for stellar customer service, only for kindness to other humans. I have been there twice before and once had excellent service and the other time it was fine and unremarkable. I guess they can‚Äôt all be stars. ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è
